Items.Title: The Public Advocate will call the meeting to order.
Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum.
Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land" A.11375 / S.7432
Items.MatterName: Authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land" (A.11375/S.7432)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation  to  the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating  contributions  to the  New  York  city  employees'  retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter  two, the  fire  department  pension  fund,  subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions  to  such  retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems." A.11225 / S.7467
Items.MatterName: Rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating  contributions  to the  NYC  employees'  retirement system (A.11225/S.7467)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation  to  providing  excess benefit plans for certain retirees and other beneficiaries of the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers'  retirement  system,  the  police  pension fund, subchapter two, and the fire department pension fund, subchapter two  of  such  city;  and  to  amend the education law, in relation to providing an excess benefit plan for certain retirees and other  beneficiaries of the board of education retirement system of such city." A.11419 / S.7466
Items.MatterName: Providing  excess benefit plans for certain retirees and other beneficiaries of the NYC employees' retirement system (A.11419/S.7466)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed and reporting on the use of traffic control signal photo-monitoring system and amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988 amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of the provisions of such code, such chapter and such law." (S. 2472-A)
Items.MatterName: Number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of real property in the borough of Manhattan and to use such property and adjacent property under the jurisdiction of the New York City department of transportation for the construction of a new subway tunnel approach and a reconstructed South Ferry subway station on the Seventh Avenue subway line." (S.7578/A.11682)
Items.MatterName: Discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of real property in the borough of Manhattan. (S.7578/A.11682)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic-control signal violations; to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988 amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989 amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of the provisions of such code, such chapter and such local law." (S.7599/A.11663)
Items.MatterName: Civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic-control signal violations. (S.7599/A.11663)

Items.Title: Supplemental Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the discount rate to be allowed for prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2005, pursuant to Section 1519 of the City Charter.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission - Prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for FY'05.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750, or vacant or unimproved land; and non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health be 18 percent (18%) for Fiscal Year 2005.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission -  Interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750 (Health)

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting resolution recommending that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2005 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750 or where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid by a mortgage escrow agent be eighteen percent (18%), and nine percent (9%) in all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission -  Interest rate to be charged for FY'05 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2005 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750 or where taxes are held in escrow or where parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land, and nine percent (9%) in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for FY'05 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing Governor Patakis recent proposed cuts to public assistance spending, which would harm families struggling to make ends meet and would not provide appropriate supports for recipients of public assistance working towards permanent self-sufficiency.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Adopted by voice vote.  The following 3 Council Members formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo.
The following Council Member formally abstained from voting on this item: Council Member Vallone Jr.
Items.MatterName: Opposing Governor Pataki's recent proposed cuts to public assistance spending.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold an oversight hearing on use of the fair hearing process to challenge the Human Resources Administrations use of sanctions on persons who seek and receive public assistance.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Filed by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Filed by voice vote.  The following 3 Council Members formally objected to the pasage of this item:  Council Members Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo.
The folowing Council Member formally abstained from voting on this matter: Council Member Vallone Jr.
Items.MatterName: Use of the fair hearing process to challenge the HRA's use of sanctions on persons who seek and receive public assistance.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2005 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for any parcel where the annual real estate tax is more than $2,750 or where the real estate taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent or where the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and 9% per annum in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendation that the interest rate to be charged for FY'05 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be eighteen percent (18%) where the annual tax on parcel is more than $2,750.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel, other than a parcel that consists of vacant or unimproved land, is not more than $2,750, be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2005 in the case of any such parcel where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent; and 9% per annum in the case of all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission -  Interest rate to be charged for FY'05 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax is not more than $2,750.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel is more than $2,750 or where, irrespective of the annual tax, the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission -  Interest rate for non-payment of real estate taxes where annual tax is more than $2,750 (Health)

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for Fiscal Year 2005.
Items.MatterName: NYC Banking Commission - Prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at two percent (2%) per annum for FY'05.
